title: Ohio To Limit Solitary Confinement For Juveniles
teaser: The move comes after a Justice Department investigation found that Ohio's youth prisons frequently use long-term solitary confinement.
contentencoded:
Ohio is now one of a handful of states to restrict the use of solitary confinement for juveniles.

The move stems from a Justice Department investigation that found Ohio’s youth prisons frequently use long-term solitary confinement, especially for prisoners with mental illness.

The new changes will apply to all children in Ohioâ€™s prison system.
